subject: Management
title: The Cost of Avoidance
description: A quick win: understand The Cost of Avoidance.

hook.text: A manager avoided confronting a toxic team member for a year. Three good people quit.

buildup.text: Conflict avoidance feels like keeping the peace. It's actually letting the problem compound.

discovery.text: Studies show unaddressed conflict costs organizations an average of 2.8 hours per employee per week.

twist.text: The avoider thinks they're being kind. The team sees them as weak or complicit.

climax.text: Address conflict early when it's small. The longer you wait, the more it costs.

punchline.text: Avoiding conflict doesn't prevent damage. It ensures it.

quiz.question: What is the real cost of conflict avoidance?
options: Problems compound and good people leave
The team becomes more resilient over time
Avoidance permanently resolves most minor disputes
